tool_calls.result_content:
{"success":true,"issue":{"number":36,"title":"Document Claude behavioral preferences: proactive logging, oracle-first, aggressive delegation","state":"OPEN","labels":["ai-authored","feature","area:devtools"],"url":"https://github.com/e-vergo/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/issues/36","body":"Add the following behavioral preferences to CLAUDE.md under User Preferences:

### Proactive Bug Logging
When encountering clear bugs during work, log them autonomously via `/log` without waiting for user direction. This applies when there's unambiguous evidence of a real bug (error messages, broken behavior, failing tests).

### Oracle-First Approach
Use `sbs_oracle_query` reflexively as the default starting point for understanding:
- Where files/concepts are located
- How components relate to each other
- What exists before searching manually

This should be the go-to before Glob/Grep for orientation questions.

### Aggressive Delegation
Top-level chat serves as orchestrator only:
- Discusses requirements with user
- Spawns `sbs-developer` agents for ALL file writing
- Synthesizes results
- Rarely (if ever) writes files directly

Goal: Preserve orchestrator context by delegating implementation work to agents.

---
🤖 Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

---
🤖 Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)","created_at":"2026-02-03T01:47:25Z"},"error":null}
